Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server
  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    A server is an employee of the Manager. Server shall tell the Manager if he/she's idle, and if so, if he/she has anyone being served next. Also, a server will change its state when various actions happen with respect to the actions they do on the customers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(int serverID)
        Usual constructor for a server.
        Parameters:
        serverID - the unique ID that a server shall have.

      • Server

        public Server​(int serverID,
              boolean isIdle,
              boolean hasCustomerWaiting,
              double nextAvailableTime)
        Constructs a new instance of Server whenever there's a change in state for the server.
        Parameters:
        serverID - the unique ID for the server
        isIdle - whether the server is idle
        hasCustomerWaiting - whether any customer is waiting to be served by the Server
        nextAvailableTime - when the server is free next.

    • Method Detail

      • canServeImmediately

        public boolean canServeImmediately​(Customer potentialCustomer)
        Server tells if a potential customer can be served immediately by him/her.
        Parameters:
        potentialCustomer - a customer that might potentially be served immediately.
        Returns:
        true if Server can serve the potentialCustomer immediately

      • canServeNext

        public boolean canServeNext​(Customer potentialCustomer)
        Server tells if a potential customer can be served next by him/her if the customer waits.
        Parameters:
        potentialCustomer - a customer that might potentially be served next if he/she waits.
        Returns:
        true if Server can serve the potentialCustomer next if customer waits.

      • serveCustomerNow

        public Server serveCustomerNow​(Customer currentCustomer,
                               double serviceDuration)
        Server serves the customer now when asked by the Manager.
        Parameters:
        currentCustomer - the Customer currently being referred to.
        serviceDuration - how long it takes to serve a customer.
        Returns:
        a new instance of Server with an updated state.

      • doneServingCustomer

        public Server doneServingCustomer()
        Server is done serving customer.
        Returns:
        a new instance of Server with an updated state.

      • letCustomerWait

        public Server letCustomerWait​(Customer waitingCustomer,
                              double serviceDuration)
        If Customer is willing to wait, the Server lets the customer wait.
        Parameters:
        waitingCustomer - a customer that's waiting.
        serviceDuration - how long it takes to serve a customer.
        Returns:
        a new instance of Server with an updated state.

      • finallyServeCustomer

        public Server finallyServeCustomer​(Customer waitingCustomer)
        Server serves a waiting customer finally, once the previous Customer has been served.
        Parameters:
        waitingCustomer - a customer that's waiting.
        Returns:
        a new instance of Server with an updated state.
